skills.name: Read an integer on a scale where the required measurement is marked by a dash between two numbers

explanations.A: Double check where the water goes up to, it's higher than 300 but not as high as 400... What is the value of each dash?
explanations.B: I think you can tell the water is one dash higher than 300ml but what is each dash worth? It's more than 1ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder
explanations.C: I think you can tell the water is one dash higher than 300ml but what is each dash worth? It's more than 10ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder
explanations.D: The water is up to the line halfway between 300ml and 400ml so the volume is 350ml.

explanations.A: The water is up to the line halfway between 100ml and 200ml so the volume is 150ml.
explanations.B: I think you saw that the water is one dash higher than 100ml but what is each dash worth? It's more than 1ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder
explanations.C: Double check where the water goes up to, it's higher than 100 but not as high as 200... What is the value of each dash?
explanations.D: I think you saw that the water is one dash higher than 100ml but what is each dash worth? It's more than 10ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder

explanations.A: This would be the value of the large black line but the arrow is pointing to the red dash next to it...
explanations.B: The arrow is pointing to the 6th dash after 300. There are 10 dashes between 300 and 400 so each one is worth 10g. 6 x 10g = 60g so the arrow is pointing to 360g.
explanations.C: The arrow is 4 dashes back from 400g so we need to take the 40g away, not add it on...
explanations.D: The arrow is pointing to the 6th dash away from 300 but each dash is not worth 1g, how much is each dash worth?

explanations.A: The arrow is 6 dashes back from 300g so we need to take the 60g away from 300, not add it on...
explanations.B: This would be the value of the bold black line but the arrow is pointing to the dash next to it...
explanations.C: The arrow is pointing to the 4th dash after 200. There are 10 dashes between 200 and 300 so each one is worth 10g. 4 x 10g = 40g so the arrow is pointing to 240g.
explanations.D: The arrow is pointing to the 4th dash away from 200 but each dash is not worth 1g, how much is each dash worth?

explanations.A: This would be the value of the large black line but the arrow is pointing to the red dash next to it...
explanations.B: The arrow is pointing to the dash after 400 but each dash is not worth 1g, how much is each dash worth?
explanations.C: The arrow is pointing to the dash after 400 but each dash is not worth 2g, how much is each dash worth?
explanations.D: The arrow is pointing to the dash after 400. There are 10 dashes between 400 and 500 so each one is worth 10g, therefore the arrow is pointing to 410g.

explanations.A: This is the nearest value that is labelled, but the arrow is pointing to the small red dash two along from 300...
explanations.B: The arrow is two dashes after 300. There are 10 dashes between 300 and 400 so each one is worth 10g, therefore the arrow is pointing to 320g.
explanations.C: The arrow is 8 dashes back from 400g so we need to take 80g away from 400, not add it on...
explanations.D: The arrow is two dashes after 300 but each dash is not worth 1g, how much is each dash worth?

explanations.A: Double check where the water goes up to, it's higher than 1 litre but not as high as 1200ml... What is the value of each dash?
explanations.B: This is the correct volume, but the wrong unit...
explanations.C: Each dash is worth 100 ml and 1l is 1000 ml therefore the water level is 1000 ml + 100ml = 1100ml
explanations.D: I think you can tell the water is one dash higher than 1l but what is each dash worth? It's more than 50ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder

explanations.A: Double check where the water goes up to, it's higher than 800 ml but not as high as 1 litre... What is the value of each dash?
explanations.B: I think you can tell the water is one dash above 800 ml but what is each dash worth? It's more than 50ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder
explanations.C: I think you can tell the water is one dash below 1 l but what is each dash worth? It's more than 50ml... Have another look at the graduated cylinder
explanations.D: There is one dash in between 800ml and 1000ml (1 litre), so each dash is worth 100ml. 800ml + 100ml = 900ml

explanations.A: 0 to 1 kg is split into 5 large parts, each part is not worth 100g. Do 1kg รท 5 to work out the value of each large part...
explanations.B: 1kg = 1000g and 0 to 1000g is split into 20 parts therefore each part is worth 1000 รท 20 = 50g. The arrow is pointing to the fourth part along 4 x 50 = 200 therefore it is pointing to 200g.
explanations.C: The arrow is pointing to the fourth part but each part is not worth 10g. To work out the value of each part divide 1000g by 20...
explanations.D: The arrow is pointing to the fourth part but each part is not worth 1kg. To work out the value of each part divide 1000g by 20...

explanations.A: The arrow is pointing to the third large mark but each mark is not 1kg. To work out what the bold marks on the scale represent, divide 1000g by 5...
explanations.B: 0 to 1 kg is split into 5 large parts, each part is not worth 100g. Do 1kg รท 5 to work out the value of each large part...
explanations.C: 0 to 1 kg is split into 5 large parts, 1kg = 1000g. 1000 รท 5 = 200 so each large mark is for 200g. 200 x 3 = 600 so the arrow at the third large mark is pointing to 600g.
explanations.D: The arrow is pointing to the twelfth mark but each mark is not 1kg. To work out what the scale is counting up in, divide 1000g by 20...
